content: Wow let's start the project when you use a
square dowel that you could get from just about any craft or hardware store
and you can see it has the barcode on the end there I want to take that off so
I'm going to use a stand paper tool I have here and just gently rub it off and
just take that right off there so this is a hat this is a half centimeter or
what you could use a quarter of an inch now I've got a guide my small hacksaw
and my pencil and I'm gonna measure I want a six inch stick so I'll just
measure six inches and Mark it and then I'm gonna put on the guide now use this
clip and it holds it nicely in place that's a nice tip okay so I'll cut that
with the hacksaw in fast motion of course and now I've got my sandpaper
sand to let's just sand the end of that up to clean it up it's all good to go so
don't want to paint it I will just leave it this color
some use a golden brown and it's nice to use a lighter brown so you can see the
marks cuz we're gonna put marks on this so I'll paint part of it and just hold
the very tip there something get my fingers paint on my fingers and now it's
dried I'll paint the end there so it'll be a nice nice golden brown ready to go
let it dry okay so we've got our stick dry nice six-inch measure there but we
want to do the increments of the measure so we're going to use our ruler and
we'll just measure each inch with the pencil and I'm gonna mark with a sharpie
so now I have a darker line there okay so now I got my six inch stick now
here's an array of sticks but I want to show you the six inch first this is
great for D&D it's six inches which is essentially 30 feet in miniature scale
you can also use it for savage worlds which every inch is two yards and savage
worlds but they generally move six inches so there we go you just move them
along with stick however far they move now these are from tales of blades and
heroes it's got the short measure the medium
measure and the long measure and I just did those different colors so you could
easily differentiate the sticks and there we go there's there's our sticks
here's a piece of terrain and let's say our guy is gonna come to this so we our
guy is hiding behind the terrain and then we he sees an enemy or something
behind so he can either try to go over it and you know take some penalties or
he'd go around it so say he moves six he can make measure three and then three
and then he goes around and that's all there is to de measuring so there's some
really easy sticks you can make for all your games and I'll see you next time on
the craft hey you yeah you back here huh I know it was short but what do you
expect there was a short tip watch longer episodes if you want geez quit
bugging me hey and make sure you join the forum too
much for that oh yeah and have a magical craft tastic day
